intro: Between Spark-E Unlimited (“Contractor”) and the Client listed above, this Agreement governs the provision of electrical services.
acknowledgment: I have read, understand, and agree to all terms and conditions set forth in this Electrical Work Agreement, and I hereby acknowledge that this document constitutes a legally binding contract between myself and Spark-E Unlimited.

sections.title: 1. Scope of Work
sections.body: Contractor will perform electrical services as described in the attached estimate or in writing. Any change orders must be approved in writing by Client and may incur additional fees

sections.title: 2. Licensing & Compliance
sections.body: Contractor confirms it holds a valid Ontario Electrical Safety Authority (ESA) contractor licence and that all work will be performed by licensed personnel in compliance with the Ontario Electrical Code and ESA regulations .

sections.title: 3. Estimate & Payment Terms
body: Final Payment: Due upon project completion
Accepted payment methods: e-transfer, cheque, or methods approved by Contractor. Late payment may incur interest or collection fees.

sections.title: 4. Schedule
body: Schedule may shift due to weather, supply delays, or unforeseen conditions.

sections.title: 5. Materials & Equipment
sections.body: Specify who supplies materials: Contractor-supplied materials are included in estimate; Client-supplied or special-order materials may result in additional charges.

sections.title: 6. Permits & Inspections
sections.body: Contractor will obtain electrical permits and arrange ESA inspections. Fees are included unless otherwise noted.

sections.title: 7. Warranty
sections.body: Contractor provides a one-year workmanship warranty covering installation defects. Coordination of ESA inspection is included. Warranty does not cover noncontracted modifications, misuse, system alterations, or third-party damages

sections.title: 8. Indemnification & Insurance
sections.body: Client and Contractor agree to indemnify and hold harmless the other from claims due to negligence or breach, except for gross negligence or willful misconduct. Contractor maintains liability insurance and can provide proof upon request .

sections.title: 9. Limitation of Liability
sections.body: Contractor is not liable for delays, defects, or damage caused by pre-existing conditions, force majeure, or third parties. Damage due to Client-supplied materials, site conditions, or delays is excluded.

sections.title: 10. Confidentiality
sections.body: Both parties agree to keep the terms of this Agreement and related documents confidential and not disclose them to third parties without consent.

sections.title: 11. Assignment & Delegation
sections.body: Neither party may assign or delegate their rights or obligations under this Agreement without prior written consent. Contractor may subcontract portions of the work, but remains responsible for performance quality.

sections.title: 12. Cancellations & Rescheduling
body: Cancellation less than 48 hours before start forfeits deposit.
Rescheduling must be requested at least 48 hours prior.

sections.title: 13. Exclusivity & Commitment
sections.body: Upon payment of deposit and signing this Agreement, the Client agrees not to contract other providers for the same work unless this Agreement is formally canceled in writing.

sections.title: 14. Term & Termination
sections.body: The Agreement remains in force until work is completed or one party terminates in writing. Early termination by Client requires written notice; Contractor may retain deposit and payment for completed work.

sections.title: 15. Dispute Resolution & Governing Law
sections.body: Disputes will first be addressed by informal negotiations. If unresolved, parties agree to mediation or arbitration in Ontario under Ontario law. Governing law: laws of Ontario.

sections.title: 16. Entire Agreement
sections.body: This document plus attached estimate or change orders constitutes the entire agreement and supersedes prior understandings. Amendments must be in writing and signed by both parties.
sections.title: Electrical Work Agreement
Scope of Work
sections.text: Contractor will perform electrical services as described in the attached estimate or in writing. Any change orders must be approved in writing by the Client and may incur additional fees.

sections.title: Licensing & Compliance
sections.text: Contractor confirms it holds a valid Ontario Electrical Safety Authority (ESA) contractor licence. All work will be performed by licensed personnel in compliance with the Ontario Electrical Code and ESA regulations.

sections.title: Estimate & Payment Terms
sections.text:
Estimated Total (ex. tax): $__________
Deposit: 50% due before work commences ($__________)
Final Payment: Due upon project completion
Accepted payment methods: e‑transfer, cheque, or methods approved by Contractor. Late payment may incur interest or collection fees.

sections.title: Schedule
sections.text:
Start On or Around: _______________________
Estimated Completion Date: __________________
Schedule may shift due to weather, supply delays, or unforeseen conditions.

sections.title: Materials & Equipment
sections.text: Contractor‑supplied materials are included in the attached estimate. Client‑supplied or special‑order materials may result in additional charges.

sections.title: Permits & Inspections
sections.text: Contractor will obtain electrical permits and arrange ESA inspections. Fees are included unless otherwise noted.

sections.title: Warranty
sections.text: Contractor provides a one‑year workmanship warranty covering installation defects. ESA inspection coordination is included. Warranty does not cover non‑contracted modifications, misuse, system alterations, or third‑party damages.

sections.title: Included & Excluded Work
sections.text:
Included: Only the work, labour, materials, permits, and inspections explicitly listed in the attached itemized estimate are included.
Excluded: Unless expressly stated in the estimate, the following items are not included: drywall repair or finishing; landscaping; fixture relocation; painting; excavation or structural site work; landscape lighting; HVAC modifications; owner‑supplied fixtures; professional fees (e.g. engineering); work beyond visible site conditions. This list is representative but not exhaustive—any work not listed as included is considered excluded. Additional services require a written change order and may affect cost and schedule.

sections.title: Estimate Terms, Price Disclaimer & Legal Clauses

subsections.title: Material Price Disclaimer & Follow‑Up Quotation
subsections.text: Material pricing is based on current supplier costs and selected budget‑level materials as of the date above. If the Client selects upgraded materials (e.g. premium pot lights) or supplier pricing increases prior to procurement, a revised quote will be issued, which must be approved in writing before ordering or installation proceeds. Final invoice will reflect actual materials supplied and invoiced.

subsections.title: Estimate Validity Period
subsections.text: This estimate remains valid for 30 calendar days from the issue date. Contractor may withdraw or revise pricing if work has not commenced within this time.

subsections.title: Notification of Material Price Changes
subsections.text: Contractor will promptly notify the Client in writing of any supplier cost increases or material specification changes that materially affect pricing. A revised quote must be signed before proceeding.

subsections.title: Client Option on Material Selection
subsections.text: Client may elect to proceed with the materials and brands listed in the estimate to avoid delay. If material changes are requested later, revised pricing and written Client approval will be required.

subsections.title: Scope Changes & Additional Work
subsections.text: Any modifications—including increased quantities, upgraded materials, additional circuits, or hidden site conditions—not covered by this estimate will require a written change order and may impact cost and schedule.

subsections.title: Pricing Adjustment Clause
subsections.text: If material costs increase significantly (e.g. due to inflation, tariffs, or supplier surcharges) by more than 5%, Contractor reserves the right to adjust pricing proportionately. Any adjustment will be communicated in writing and requires Client approval before proceeding with ordering.

subsections.title: Payment Terms
subsections.text: A 50% deposit is due prior to work commencement; remaining balance is due on completion. Accepted payment methods: e‑transfer, cheque, or methods approved by Contractor. Outstanding amounts beyond 7 days from invoice may incur a 1.5% monthly late fee.

subsections.title: Contingency & Site Assumptions
subsections.text: The estimate assumes conditions visible during inspection. Concealed infrastructure or obstacles may lead to additional charges. Refer to the exclusions list.

sections.title: Indemnification & Insurance
sections.text: Client and Contractor agree to indemnify and hold harmless the other from claims arising from negligence or breach, except for gross negligence or willful misconduct. Contractor maintains liability insurance and can provide proof upon request.

sections.title: Limitation of Liability
sections.text: Contractor is not liable for delays, defects, or damage caused by pre‑existing conditions, force majeure, or third parties. Damage due to Client‑supplied materials, site conditions, or delays is excluded.

sections.title: Confidentiality
sections.text: Both parties agree to keep the terms of this Agreement and related documents confidential and not disclose them to third parties without consent.

sections.title: Assignment & Delegation
sections.text: Neither party may assign or delegate their rights or obligations except by prior written consent. Contractor may subcontract portions of the work but remains responsible for performance quality.

sections.title: Cancellations & Rescheduling
sections.text: Cancellation less than 48 hours before the scheduled start forfeits deposit. Rescheduling must be requested at least 48 hours in advance.

sections.title: Exclusivity & Commitment
sections.text: By signing and paying the deposit, the Client agrees not to engage other providers for the same work unless this Agreement is formally canceled in writing.

sections.title: Term & Termination
sections.text: This Agreement remains in force until work is complete or terminated in writing. Early termination by Client requires written notice; Contractor may retain deposit and compensation for work performed.

sections.title: Dispute Resolution & Governing Law
sections.text: Disputes will first be addressed through informal negotiations. If unresolved, parties agree to mediation or arbitration in Ontario under Ontario law.

sections.title: Entire Agreement
sections.text: This document—together with the attached estimate and any written change orders—constitutes the entire agreement and supersedes all prior understandings. Amendments must be in writing and signed by both parties.

sections.title: Client Acceptance & Acknowledgment
sections.text:
“I hereby accept this estimate and authorize Spark‑E Unlimited to proceed under the terms described above.”

☐ I have read, understand, and agree to all terms and conditions set forth in this estimate and acknowledge that this document is an approximation only—not a finalized quote or binding contract. Final pricing will be determined based on approved materials, scope, and actual invoicing.

Client Signature: _________________________  Date: __________

Contractor Signature: ______________________ Ryan Maxwell, Spark‑E Unlimited  Date: __________
